name: Born This Way Super Coverage Multi-Use Concealer
about: What it is: A hydrating, full-coverage, weightless, four-in-one, concealer that conceals, contours, highlights, and retouches in a wide range of flawless shades...Coverage: Full..Finish: Natural..Formulation: Liquid..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Coconut Water: Aids in delicately replenishing skinu2019s moisture levels..- Alpine Rose: Helps support skinu2019s health and resilience..- Hyaluronic Acid: Gives a smoother, more youthful appearance...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens. It is also vegan and cruelty-free...What Else You Need to Know: A little goes a long way with this long-wearing, buildable, multitasking concealer masks imperfections, smooths, and sculpts skin for natural-looking coverage. This formula is non-comedogenic and offers a crease-free, weightless wear thatu2019s so naturally flawless theyu2019ll think you were born this way.
ingredients: Water/Aqua/Eau, Cyclopentasiloxane, Butylene Glycol Dicaprylate/Dicaprate, Isoamyl Laurate, Triethylhexanoin, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Cetyl Peg/Ppg-10/1 Dimethicone, Polyglyceryl-4 Diisostearate/Polyhydroxystearate/Sebacate, Methyl Trimethicone, Dimethicone, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Acrylates/Polytrimethylsiloxymethacrylate Copolymer, Sodium Hyaluronate, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Liquid Endosperm, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Fruit Juice, Rhododendron Ferrugineum Extract, Dimethicone/Vinyl Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Silica, Sodium Chloride, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, 1,2-Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate, [+/- Iron Oxides (Ci 77491), Iron Oxides (Ci 77492), Iron Oxides (Ci 77499), Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891)] .Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up to date list of ingredients.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.Conceal: .-Apply a dot of concealer under eyes or over hyperpigmentationu2014wherever you need extra u2014and tap with fingers or a sponge until blended to a flawless finish. It even hides tattoos...Contour: .-Choose neutral or cool concealer shades three tones darker than your skin tone to create realistic shadow and shape...Highlight: .-Choose a shade two to three shades lighter than your natural skin tone and in your same undertone. .-Apply concealer to high points of face for a flawlessly sculpted look...Retouch: .-One dot of concealer refreshes makeup like you just applied a full face. Just press on wherever your makeup looks tired.

reviews.review_title: Good formula but not a great color match
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I first bought this concealer based on the good reviews and have been using it for the past two years now. The formula itself feels good, but the color match leaves something to be desired. Not sure how I didn't think to check whether the concealer color matched my foundation, but once I swatched them side by side the difference was startling. This concealer shade called Snow looked practically tan! And the shade description claims that it's for very fair skin with neutral to rosy undertones. I'm not seeing any of those descriptors in the concealer I've been using. I thought about trying the shades Cloud and Marshmallow (the lightest shades Too Faced offers which claim that they're for pinkish undertones), but honestly I don't know if that's worth the money. Maybe one day I'll come back to this product, but not anytime soon.

PROS: -Lots of product. 13.5 mL is crazy! -Full coverage!! :) Coverage is similar to the Elf hydrating Camo concealer -Easy to blend. -Creamy consistency -Bottle seems like itu2019s glass, so it doesnu2019t feel cheap (unlike the Huda concealer) -Great shade range (for the lighter skin tones at least)  CONS: -Very pricey! $49 CAD is no joke. -Very large bottle, so itu2019s not travel friendly. -Creases SO BAD (see images!!) no matter what I do! :(   For reference, here are the foundation shades I wear, and the concealer shades that are good matches for me (I like a lighter concealer): -Estee Lauder Double Wear foundation; shade 2N2 -Maybelline FitMe Matte + Poreless foundation; shade 120 -Huda Beauty Faux Filter Matte concealer; shade 2.3 Cotton Candy -Elf Hydrating Camo concealer; shade Light Ivory

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I own a number of concealers and this is one of the ones I keep coming back to. It's quite thick, highly pigmented and gives excellent full coverage which lasts up to 10 hours on my skin. As long as I've used setting powder after, and moisturized well before, I find only very minimal creasing or settling into lines as the day wears on. I mostly use it under the eye area - a pea size amount is more than sufficient. I also use it as a highlighter and to disguise the odd blemish. A little goes a very long way with this one and often I find I've applied more than I needed to. Not a fan of the doe foot applicator, it's too large for precise application (blemishes) although works well on larger surfaces such as under the eyes. The bottle too is large, it's literally the same size as a foundation bottle, perhaps the biggest concealer I've seen so you definitely get your money's worth here!    Got this in the 'Honey' shade which seemed fine when trying on in-store, however it seems somehow slightly darker once I got home and applied it. I usually switch to a lighter shade of both foundation and concealer during winter and in this case I will definitely have to. The only slight downside is; unlike my HG concealer (Mac Studio Finish) there's no SPF in here so I have to apply a sunblock separately, before concealer.  ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It is difficult to find good quality makeup. Multiple makeup companies keep pumping out new products claiming it is the Holy Grail. The Too Faced concealers coverage is exceptionally well compared to other brand-named concealers. It has excellent durability; therefore, less is needed to reapply. The value of this concealer can be costly to some customers, but it can be justified with the amount of product given. The Too Faced concealer is a concealer worth trying due to its coverage, durability, and value.   The Too Faced concealer gives a good quality coverage. It covers my eyebags, blemishes, and any discoloration I may have. It is lightweight, so it is like my skin but better. Since it gives great coverage, not much is needed to be used. I have two shades for this concealer: natural beige and light beige. With the natural beige I love using it as a foundation due to its coverage and with the light beige I use it for concealer. The concealer is buildable and does not leave me feeling or looking cakey. It blends nicely on my skin. Although I was able to find a match, I cannot say the same for everyone. It is difficult to find your correct shade because the concealer oxidizes and does not have the best shade range. I recommend you swatch shades and let them sit for a few minutes to find a better match.  The durability of the concealer is decent. It does not budge throughout the entire day. Prepping is key to long lasting makeup. The Too Faced concealer is water-based, so it is best to use a water-based primer and other makeup products that are compatible. Because I have combination skin, parts of my skin get oily while other parts might get a little dry. Even so, I have had almost no problem with this concealers ability to last the entire day. The only thing I have had a problem with is it creasing under my eyes. After using multiple different setting powders, it still finds a way to crease. I will continue to use this product because even though it does crease unde

reviews.review_text: I tried this concealer when it first launched and I have never looked back. The coverage is fantastic- it is similar to the ever-so-popular Tarte Shape Tape, but more hydrating. It gives the under eyes a smooth appearance and has a your-skin-but-better look.  It lasts through anything! I've had many crying sessions while wearing this concealer and it stays PERFECT. I usually set it with a powder, which probably helps, but I don't think many concealers would be able to withstand that even when set with a powder! I also use a shade that matches my face to cover acne and it works wonderfully. This concealer blends out so nicely that sometimes I can just cover up problem areas with it, not apply any foundation, and go out looking great. Another plus is that the bottle is huge. I'm pretty sure this tube contains double what a typical concealer tube offers. One tube lasts me about a year.  This concealer is my ride-or-die and I have literally no interest in trying anything else!
